description: Dive into "Whispers of Romance in Bunkyo" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Romance in Bunkyo

places.generalDescription: Sakurajima, an active stratovolcano in Kagoshima, Japan, was once an island until a massive 1914 eruption connected it to the Osumi peninsula. This volcano has erupted around 30 times throughout history and continues to emit steam and ash. With ties to Naples, Italy as its sister city, Kagoshima is often referred to as the 'Naples of the Orient.' The region enjoys a balmy climate most of the year.

sources.snippet: At an elevation of 1,117 meters and a circumference of about 50 kilometers, Sakurajima is a symbol of Kagoshima and one of Japan’s most active volcanoes. It was originally known as the “cherry blossom island” before the Taisho eruption in 1914, which connected the volcano to the main island of Kyushu. Today, it stands tall and proud in Kagoshima Bay and can be seen from various places around the city.
sources.shortName: Visit Sakurajima: A Volcano in the Middle of Kagoshima City

sources.snippet: Japan is known for its numerous active volcanoes and one of the most popular and active volcanoes can be found in Kagoshima. Tour the volcanic island of Sakurajima before you explore the other attractions for a beautiful start of your vacation. If you observe carefully, you can see constant volcano smokes as well as minor eruptions that happen frequently in a day.
sources.shortName: Top 26 Things To Do In Kagoshima, Japan - Updated 2024

sources.snippet: The city is often compared with its Italian sister city Naples due to a similarly mild climate, palm tree-lined streets, relatively hot tempered inhabitants and rumbling Mount Sakurajima, Kagoshima's Vesuvius.
sources.shortName: Kagoshima Travel Guide - What to do in Kagoshima City

sources.snippet: The mountain on it is a volcano, and there are often small eruptions, so you can see that there is often smoke surrounding it. It is a very wonderful experience and the scenery is very beautiful.
Our itinerary for the moment includes Sakurajima, hiking Kaimondake, sightseeing around the Satsuma peninsula, maybe a sand bath in Ibusuki. Pretty standard stuff since I don’t know the area.
The city is best known for the spectacular Sakurajima volcano which looms next to it and this is also a great place to use a base if you want to explore the neighboring islands of Okinawa.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Kagoshima (Japan)

sources.snippet: Established in 1658 by the 19th generation lord, Mitsuhisa, Senganen Garden used to function as a guesthouse, offering a stunning view of Sakurajima, the iconic volcano in Kagoshima.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Recommended Tourist Spots in Kagoshima! Introducing must-visit places like World Heritage sites and popular hot springs! | Travel and tourism information for Japan

sources.snippet: Additionally, Kagoshima hosts Japan’s most active volcano in the way of Sakurajima, and guests can catch the explosive action that spurts out a couple of times a day!
sources.shortName: 22 Best Things to Do in Kagoshima | Bucket List Ideas | Attractions | Activities

sources.snippet: We were able to see Sakurajima, the city’s iconic volcanic island, from the garden. It was too bad about the gloomy weather, but at least it didn’t rain!
sources.shortName: How to Have Fun in Kagoshima

sources.snippet: Most of the prefecture's mainland lies on the Satsuma and Osumi Peninsulas, and Sakurajima, the symbol of Kagoshima, is surrounded by these peninsulas.
sources.siteName: Telecom Times | Useful information on international travel and Wi-Fi
sources.shortName: Wi-Fi and Travel Information in Kagoshima, Japan: Your Ultimate Guide - Telecom Times

places.name: Sakurajima

reviews.text: This volcano is a true highlight of Kagoshima. It's one of the most active in Japan, so you might even see smoke puffing out the top!  The island itself is a neat mix of classic Japanese town and volcanic landscape, creating a really unique atmosphere. There are lots of cool things to see and do here, making it a great place to spend a trip.

It's a must place to visit in Kagoshima. I went there by ferry at 7.30, but the tourist centre and rental bike shops weren't open until 9am. I wasted a lot of time doing nothing on the island. The sight-seeing bus was convenient, but only the western part of the island is covered by it.
Sakurajima is a ‘must-do' if you are in Kagoshima. Take a twenty minutes ferry ride to the island. If you have the time, there are quite a few spots to visit.

places.generalDescription: Sengan-en is a historic Japanese garden and former residence of a feudal lord, showcasing traditional design and stunning volcano views. The garden was created over 300 years ago by the Shimadzu clan, incorporating the surrounding landscape into its layout. Visitors can explore bamboo groves, a scenic waterfall, and a serene pond. This picturesque setting was once used for famous poem-composing garden parties hosted by the Shimadzu family.

sources.snippet: Adjacent to Sengan-en, this 1850s building, a Unesco World Heritage site as Japan's first modern factory, has been converted into a museum.

This garden that overlooks Sakurajima is home to an old daimyo residence, beautiful trees, flowers, a pond, restaurant, and even a souvenir shop. Events that help visitors experience Japanese culture, such as experiences where you can put on full sets of armor, are also popular.
sources.shortName: 3 Spots to Enjoy When Visiting Kagoshima and Sakurajima Together | GOOD LUCK TRIP

sources.snippet: Also known as Iso-teien, Sengan-en is a gorgeous section of gardens in Kagoshima which are said to date from 1658. In the days of old the gardens would have been designed by a Shimazu lord, but they are still every bit as impressive now as they would have been back then.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Kagoshima (Japan)
How to Have Fun in Kagoshima

sources.siteName: Telecom Times | Useful information on international travel and Wi-Fi
sources.shortName: Wi-Fi and Travel Information in Kagoshima, Japan: Your Ultimate Guide - Telecom Times

places.name: Sengan-en

reviews.text: Truly worth visiting of you visit Kagoshima. A magnificent historical site with the majestic view of Sakurajima and breathtakingly beautiful Japanese garden. You might also see a wedding couple in Japanese traditional wedding dress too.

A beautiful historic residence with stunning gardens and a scenic view of Mt. Sakurajima. Originally built by the powerful Shimazu clan, this estate served as a retreat for the feudal lords of Satsuma.

The site features well maintained traditional architecture, peaceful green spaces, and carefully designed Japanese gardens that blend harmoniously with the natural surroundings. Walking through the area, you'll find small shrines, ponds, and historical artifacts that offer insight into Samurai culture and the region's history.

The entrance fee is 1,600 yen for an adult (as of March 2025). While a bit pricey, the experience is worth it for those interested in Japanese history, gardens, and scenic views. A great place to explore, relax, and take in the beauty of Kagoshima.

Don't list to the people who don't understand how beautiful this is. It is a water garden in 3 dimensions with much more vertical interest than many. It's hard to appreciate from photos but absolutely worth the admission!

The gardens are the main attraction but you can also see the simple residence and walk up the mountain a bit

places.generalDescription: The Museum of the Meiji Restoration in Kagoshima City is a small history museum dedicated to the Meiji restoration period in 19th-century Imperial Japan. It provides an informative journey into the past, focusing on Saigo Takamori, also known as 'The Last Samurai,' and his role in the modernization movement that led to the Meiji Restoration of 1868. The museum offers well-marked exhibits and even features a show re-enacting this dramatic moment in history with robots.

sources.snippet: The current building of this large Buddhist temple near Tenmonkan dates from 1982 and was renovated in 2013. Inside, it's unlike most temples you may have…
Popular points of interest near Sheraton Kagoshima include Kagoshima Chuo Station, Korai Bridge and Museum of the Meiji Restoration. Kagoshima Airport is 39 km from the property.
sources.shortName: Kagoshima Travel Guide - What to do in Kagoshima City

sources.snippet: Here you can learn all about how samurai would have lived in the days of old and even learn about how swords were made and handled.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Kagoshima (Japan)

places.name: Museum of the Meiji Restoration

reviews.text: I never expected such a beautiful museum there in the middle of the city. It's close ( 5 mins by bus) to Kagoshima Chuo station; it's an excellent place to get to know to the history of Meiji era and the contribution of Kagoshima's Samurai clan. The museum offers a stage show with robotic appearance as samurai. It's AWESOME ! If you love history, this is your place! My 5 years old also enjoyed this place.

A well-presented museum with varied displays. Almost all in Japanese but several photos etc do have an English caption or summary.
The two films very the best to me, cleverly done and multi-lingual earphones allowed us to listen in English. Interesting!

Very well done museum for those interested. Great to learn about this in former Satsuma. The museum is well kept, and the exhibits are informative. There is enough English guidance, and the show even has English audio. Very accessible and foreigner friendly.

places.generalDescription: Mawaru Sushi Mekkemon Dolphin Port is a sushi restaurant located in Kagoshima, near the ferry terminal and the Dolphin Port shopping center. The restaurant offers fast service, a friendly atmosphere, and a variety of fresh seafood dishes. Customers can choose from the menu or pick cold dishes from the conveyor belt, with sushi plates ranging in price. Popular dishes include seared salmon with mayonnaise, tuna chunks, sweet prawns, scallops, and eel.

sources.snippet: The waterfront is decorated with beautiful 205,000 lights again this year.An 8 meter-high Christmas tree welcome you at the front of the building.Dolphins and wave shaped lights glittering on the water, and 260m of lights along the deck are so pretty!. Clownfish, blue tangs and other fish are swimming in a fantastic cylindrical sea made with lights.In addition to a popular photo spot “Happy Heart Station” with a big heart and an angel, “New Dream World” with a pumpkin carriage and a gift box are there this year.*Click here for the details and the map. 〈Details〉Date: November 4 (Fri) ~ Feberuary 28 (Tue)Time: Sunset ~ 24:00Place: Dolphin Port (5-4 Honko-shinmachi, Kagoshima city)Tel: Dolphin Port 099-221-5777Parking: 750 spaces (30 minutes free, 100 yen / 30 minutes after the first 30 minutes)* Parking discount available if you buy or eat (depending on the cost) at Dolphin Port.
sources.shortName: Illumination 2016 ~ 2017 in Kagoshima | KAGOSHIMA Visitors' GUIDE

places.name: Mawaru Sushi Mekkemon Dolphin Port

reviews.text:
The restaurant opens at 17.00. We arrived here at 16:47 on Friday, soon started queue up. Luckily, we were the first one to get in.

Unforgettable experience! Friendly service, fresh ingredients, with impressive mountain view. Worth trying!

Don't let the wait time deter you-this sushi restaurant is nice! Even arriving early on a weekday evening (around 5:30 PM), I experienced a significant two-hour wait. While the limited waiting area seating was a bit of a challenge, and I observed many locals opting to wait in their cars, the eventual reward was worth it.

The staff's kindness, especially towards foreigners, was truly exceptional. Their patience and attentiveness made the long wait more bearable. Once seated, both the chefs and waitresses were incredibly welcoming, consistently checking on my preferences and ensuring a delightful dining experience.

And the sushi? fantastic! The fish was incredibly fresh, and the flavors were simply outstanding. The quality of the ingredients and the chef's skill. But some in menu is so-so.

Despite the extended wait, the overall experience I love is superb service, coupled with the delectable sushi. Just be sure to plan your visit accordingly and be prepared for a potential wait.

Everything was amazing. The food, service, the staff were hands down unmatched. I stumbled across this place because I was searching for something else. I walked in and was immediately ushered to the counter since I was alone. I grabbed sushi as it went around and asked for wasabi from the chefs. The soup was delicious, the variety of sushi was outstanding. I'll definitely be back next year.
